intro: Descurainia canoensis, commonly known as the yellow tansy, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a rough texture. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields and along roadsides. Descurainia canoensis is known for its ability to tolerate various environmental conditions, making it a common weed in agricultural settings.
